intro: Carex toyoshimae, commonly known as the Toyoshima sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers that are usually green or brown in color. It is native to Japan and is often found in the mountainous regions of the country. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Carex toyoshimae is considered a rare and endangered species.
